content.description:
This is a really cool right entrance to

Stunt Double

.

There is a possible direct finish; however, the crux is dab avoidance.

If anyone knows of a name or previous ascent, please do not hesitate to let me know!
content.protection: This is so lowball you couldn't even limbo it. Maybe use 2 pads because of the traversing factor.
content.location:
Start with your left hand on an undercling and your right hand on a down-pulling hold. Climb up and left utilizing heelhooks and toehooks, This basically starts to the right of

Stunt Double

and climb' into the same topout.

content.description: Start under the roof with a half pad undercling crimp and fingernails for your right. Throw out right for the crack, work the feet out right, and move your left hand to the top of the crack on the lip. Move out left to better holds. Top it out!
content.location: On Ute Boulder, this ascends the obvious cave roof. It has an easy topout. For the start holds, look for the only thing you can get your fingers in.

content.description:
Stand start with a right hand on the large edge and a left hand palmed on the face. From there, paste a foot, and then work up and slight left on the edges to reach an easy mantle.

There is a potential sit to this one that would definitely raise the difficulty.
content.protection: A pad will work well. The landing is very good.
content.location: It climbs the south section of Ute's west face.

content.description: On the big steep side of Ute Rock, start crossed sitting in a rail, make a powerful move with your left hand to an okay crimp, set up, & do a double clutch move to the feature. From here, I exited left via a juggy V4/5 sequence. Though recently Greg Locker has completed the right exit, it adds a V9 after the jump bringing the boulder to V11.
content.protection: Use 4-8 pads depending on which exit you are keen on.
content.location: This is on the big north face of the boulder.

content.description: Stand start with hands matched on the obvious edge about six feet off the deck. From there, work up and slight left through a pair of edges, eventually gain a foot on the start hold, then finish straight up the remaining features for an easy mantle.
content.protection: A pad or two will be fine. The landing is perfect.
content.location: It climbs the center of Ute's west face.
